message.content:
cs.SY, cs.LG, cs.CE, cs.DC, cs.RO

Reasoning: 
- cs.SY (Systems and Control): The paper deals with optimal control of linear systems, which falls under the scope of this sub-category. 
- cs.LG (Machine Learning): Although the paper does not explicitly mention machine learning, the use of heuristic algorithms and optimization techniques may be relevant to this sub-category. 
- cs.CE (Computational Engineering, Finance, and Science): The paper involves solving quadratic programs and analyzing stability, which are computational tasks relevant to this sub-category. 
- cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing): The use of the Alternating Direction Method of Multipliers (ADMM) method may be relevant to this sub-category, which deals with distributed computing. 
- cs.RO (Robotics): Although the paper does not mention robotics, the use of event-triggered control may be relevant to this sub-category, which deals with control and automation of robotic systems.
